00039 #ifdef _WIN32
00040 // Windows doesn't seem to have these defined, so we'll define them
00041 // here for utility. Note that with the windows _stat() function all
00042 // users have id 0 and group 0.
00043 #define S_IRUSR 00400 //owner has read permission
00044 #define S_IWUSR 00200 //owner has write permission
00045 #define S_IXUSR 00100 ///owner has execute permission
00046 #define S_IRWXG 00070 //mask for group permissions
00047 #define S_IRGRP 00040 //group has read permission
00048 #define S_IWGRP 00020 //group has write permission
00049 #define S_IXGRP 00010 //group has execute permission
00050 #define S_IRWXO 00007 //mask for permissions for others (not in group)
00051 #define S_IROTH 00004 //others have read permission
00052 #define S_IWOTH 00002 //others have write permisson
00053 #define S_IXOTH 00001 // others have execute permission
00054 #endif

00078 #include <dirent.h>

00082 // @todo all this should go into portablity/apt-posix.h
00083 #ifdef _WIN32
00084 // Microsoft limit is 32767 plus slush 100
00085 // Return and input buffer.   
00086 #define UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ (32767 + 100)
00087 #define POSIX_CHMOD  _wchmod
00088 #define POSIX_MKDIR  _wmkdir
00089 #define POSIX_UNLINK _wunlink
00090 #ifndef S_ISDIR
00091 #define S_ISDIR(m)   (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR)
00092 #endif
00093 #ifndef S_ISREG
00094 #define S_ISREG(m)   (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
00095 #endif
00096 #else
00097 #define POSIX_CHMOD  ::chmod
00098 #define POSIX_MKDIR  ::mkdir
00099 #define POSIX_UNLINK ::unlink
00100 #endif

00107 /// utility function to fill in a filesystem stat struct.
00108 AptErr_t Fs__stat(const std::string& path,
00109                   struct stat& stat_buf,
00110                   int& rv,
00111                   bool abortOnErr) {
00112 
00113   std::string errorMsg("Fs__stat");
00114   
00115 #ifndef _WIN32  
00116   rv=stat(path.c_str(),&stat_buf);
00117 #else  
00118   WIN32_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DATA win_attr_data;
00119   rv = 0;
00120   std::wstring unc_wpath = Fs::UncW( path );
00121   if ( GetFileAttributesExW(unc_wpath.c_str(), GetFileExInfoStandard, &win_attr_data) ) {
00122     memset( &stat_buf, 0 , sizeof(struct stat));
00123     if ( win_attr_data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY ) {
00124       stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IFDIR | S_IRUSR;
00125       if ( !(win_attr_data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY) ) {
00126         stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IWUSR;
00127       }
00128     }
00129     else {
00130       stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IFREG;
00131       stat_buf.st_size = (win_attr_data.nFileSizeHigh * (((int)MAXDWORD)+1)) + win_attr_data.nFileSizeLow;
00132       std::fstream fs;
00133       Fs::aptOpen(fs, path,std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
00134       if (fs.is_open()) {
00135         fs.close();
00136         stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IRUSR;
00137         if ( !(win_attr_data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY) ) {
00138           stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IWUSR;
00139         }
00140       }
00141       else {
00142         //std::cerr <<  Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString("fs.open") << std::endl;
00143       }
00144     }
00145   }
00146   else {
00147     //std::cerr << Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString("Fs__stat") << std::endl;
00148     rv = GetLastError();
00149     errorMsg = Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString("Fs__stat");
00150   }
00151   
00152 #endif  
00153   
00154   // @todo decode rv to errnum
00155   if (rv==0) {
00156     return Fs::clearErr();
00157   }
00158   return Fs::setErr(APT_ERR,errorMsg,abortOnErr);
00159 }
00160 
00161 bool Fs__isreadable(struct stat& stat_buf) {
00162   int uid;
00163   int gid;
00164 
00165 #ifdef _WIN32
00166   uid=0;
00167   gid=0;
00168 #else
00169   uid=getuid();
00170   gid=getgid();
00171 #endif
00172 
00173   if ( ((uid==stat_buf.st_uid) && (S_IRUSR&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00174        ((gid==stat_buf.st_gid) && (S_IRGRP&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00175        (S_IROTH&stat_buf.st_mode) ) {
00176     return true;
00177   }
00178   return false;
00179 }
00180 
00181 bool Fs__iswriteable(struct stat& stat_buf) {
00182   int uid;
00183   int gid;
00184 
00185 #ifdef _WIN32
00186   uid=0;
00187   gid=0;
00188 #else
00189   uid=getuid();
00190   gid=getgid();
00191 #endif
00192 
00193   if ( ((uid==stat_buf.st_uid) && (S_IWUSR&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00194        ((gid==stat_buf.st_gid) && (S_IWGRP&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00195        (S_IWOTH&stat_buf.st_mode) ) {
00196     return true;
00197   }
00198   return false;
00199 }

00206 AptErr_t Fs::setErr(AptErr_t err_num,const std::string& err_msg,bool abortOnErr) {
00207   m_err_num=err_num;
00208   m_err_msg=err_msg;
00209 
00210   if (m_err_num!=APT_OK) {
00211     // for debugging
00212     //printf("FsPath::setErr: err=%d msg='%s'\n",m_err_num,m_err_msg.c_str());
00213     //
00214     if (abortOnErr==true) {
00215       Err::errAbort(err_msg);
00216     }
00217   }
00218   return m_err_num;
00219 }

00230   m_err_num=APT_OK;

00235 /// translate
00236 AptErr_t Fs::setErrFromErrno(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
00237   return setErrFromErrno(path,errno,abortOnErr);
00238 }
00239 
00240 /// translate
00241 AptErr_t Fs::setErrFromErrno(const std::string& path,int sys_errno,bool abortOnErr) {
00242   switch (sys_errno) {
00243   case 0:
00244     return clearErr();
00245   case EEXIST:
00246     return setErr(APT_ERR_EXISTS,"exists: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00247     break;
00248   case EACCES:
00249     return setErr(APT_ERR_ACCESS,"access: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00250     break;
00251   default:
00252     return setErr(APT_ERR,"generic error: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00253     break;
00254   }
00255   return setErr(APT_ERR,"generic error: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00256 }

00260 std::string Fs::pathSep() {
00261   return std::string("/");
00262 }
00263 
00264 std::string Fs::osPathSep( const std::string & path ) {
00265   // dont use FSPATH_PATHSEP here as these should be literal strings.
00266 #ifdef _WIN32
00267   if ( path.empty() ) {
00268     return std::string("\\");
00269   }
00270   return Fs::windowifyPath(path);
00271 #else
00272   if ( path.empty() ) {
00273     return std::string("/");
00274   }
00275   return Fs::unixifyPath(path);
00276 #endif
00277   
00278 }

00282 // Dont use FSPATH_PATHSEP for these two methods
00283 // as they should be literial chars.

00285 AptErr_t Fs::normalizePathInPlace(std::string& str) {
00286   return unixifyPathInPlace(str);
00287 }
00288 
00289 std::string Fs::normalizePath(const std::string& str)
00290 {
00291   std::string tmp=str;
00292   normalizePathInPlace(tmp);
00293   return tmp;
00294 }
00295 
00296 // this is also used to unixify the string-path to our internal conventions.
00297 AptErr_t Fs::unixifyPathInPlace(std::string& str) {
00298   // fix the slashes to go the correct way.
00299   std::replace(str.begin(),str.end(),'\\','/');
00300   return APT_OK;
00301 }
00302 
00303 std::string Fs::unixifyPath(const std::string& str)
00304 {
00305   std::string tmp=str;
00306   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00307   return tmp;
00308 }
00309 
00310 /// do what needs to be done to windowify a string.
00311 AptErr_t Fs::windowifyPathInPlace(std::string& str) {
00312   // flip the slashes.
00313   std::replace(str.begin(),str.end(),'/','\\');
00314   return APT_OK;
00315 }
00316 
00317 std::string Fs::windowifyPath(const std::string& str) 
00318 {
00319   std::string tmp=str;
00320   windowifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00321   return tmp;
00322 }

00324 //////////
00325 
00326 std::string Fs::join(const std::string& arg1,
00327                      const std::string& arg2)
00328 {
00329   if (arg1=="") {
00330     return normalizePath(arg2);
00331   }
00332   if (arg2=="") {
00333     return normalizePath(arg1);
00334   }
00335   if (arg1=="/") {
00336     return "/"+normalizePath(arg2);
00337   }
00338   return normalizePath(arg1+"/"+arg2);
00339 }
00340 
00341 /// @todo could be changed not to norm
00342 std::string Fs::join(const std::string& arg1,
00343                      const std::string& arg2,
00344                      const std::string& arg3)
00345 {
00346   return join(join(arg1,arg2),arg3);
00347 }
00348 
00349 std::string Fs::join(const std::string& arg1,
00350                      const std::string& arg2,
00351                      const std::string& arg3,
00352                      const std::string& arg4)
00353 {
00354   return join(join(join(arg1,arg2),arg3),arg4);
00355 }
00356 
00357 std::string Fs::join(std::vector<std::string>& args) {
00358   std::string tmp_str;
00359 
00360   for (unsigned int i=0;i<args.size();i++) {
00361     tmp_str=Fs::join(tmp_str,args[i]);
00362   }
00363   return tmp_str;
00364 }

00367 
00368 bool Fs::hasTrailingSlash(const std::string& path) {
00369   if ((path.size()>0)&&(path.compare(path.size()-1,1,FS_PATHSEP)==0)) {
00370     return true;
00371   }
00372   return false;
00373 }
00374 
00375 std::string Fs::addTrailingSlash(const std::string& path_in)
00376 {
00377   std::string path_out=path_in;
00378   if ((path_in!="")&&(!hasTrailingSlash(path_out))) {
00379     path_out+=FS_PATHSEP;
00380   }
00381   return path_out;
00382 }
00383 
00384 std::string Fs::trimTrailingSlash(const std::string& path_in)
00385 {
00386   std::string path_out=path_in;
00387   if ((path_out!=FS_PATHSEP)&&(hasTrailingSlash(path_out))) {
00388     path_out.erase(path_out.size()-1);
00389   }
00390   return path_out;
00391 }

00393 //////////
00394 
00395 std::string Fs::basename(const std::string& path)
00396 {
00397   // unixify the string.
00398   std::string tmp_path=normalizePath(path);
00399 
00400   // should this be an error?
00401   // no as it makes taking the basename of "" fail.
00402   // we have lots of "foo=Fs::basename(getOpt("foo"))" where foo
00403   // is unset.
00404   //if (tmp_path=="") {
00405   //APT_ERR_ABORT("cant take the basename of '"+tmp_path+"'");
00406   //}
00407 
00408   //
00409   std::string::size_type pos;
00410   pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00411   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00412     return tmp_path;
00413   }
00414   tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(pos+1);
00415   //printf("Fs::basename('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00416   return tmp_path;
00417 }
00418 
00419 std::vector<std::string> Fs::basename(const std::vector<std::string>& paths)
00420 {
00421   std::vector<std::string> out;
00422   out.reserve(paths.size());
00423 
00424   for (unsigned int i=0;i<paths.size();i++) {
00425     out.push_back(basename(paths[i]));
00426   }
00427   return out;
00428 }
00429 
00430 std::string Fs::dirname(const std::string& path)
00431 {
00432   // unixify the string.
00433   std::string tmp_path=path;
00434   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00435 
00436   if (tmp_path=="") {
00437     APT_ERR_ABORT("cant take the dirname of '"+tmp_path+"'");
00438   }
00439   if ((tmp_path=="/")||(tmp_path==".")) {
00440     return tmp_path;
00441   }
00442   // a trailing slash is not included.
00443   if (tmp_path.compare(tmp_path.size()-1,1,FS_PATHSEP)==0) {
00444     tmp_path.erase(tmp_path.size()-1);
00445   }
00446 
00447   //
00448   std::string::size_type pos;
00449   pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00450   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00451     return ".";
00452   }
00453   tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(0,pos);
00454   //printf("Fs::dirname('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00455   return tmp_path;
00456 }
00457 
00458 std::string Fs::extname(const std::string& path)
00459 {
00460   // unixify the string.
00461   std::string tmp_path=basename(path);
00462 
00463   //
00464   std::string::size_type pos;
00465   pos=tmp_path.find(FS_EXTSEP);
00466   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00467     return "";
00468   }
00469   tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(pos);
00470   //printf("Fs::extname('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00471   return tmp_path;
00472 }
00473 
00474 
00475 std::string Fs::noextname(const std::string& path)
00476 {
00477   // unixify the string.
00478   std::string tmp_path=path;
00479   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00480 
00481   //
00482   std::string::size_type slash_pos;
00483   slash_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00484   if (slash_pos==std::string::npos) {
00485     slash_pos=0;
00486   }
00487   std::string::size_type ext_pos;
00488   ext_pos=tmp_path.find(FS_EXTSEP,slash_pos);
00489   if (ext_pos!=std::string::npos) {
00490     tmp_path.erase(ext_pos);
00491   }
00492   //printf("Fs::noextname('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00493   return tmp_path;
00494 }
00495 
00496 
00497 std::string Fs::noextname1(const std::string& path)
00498 {
00499   // unixify the string.
00500   std::string tmp_path=path;
00501   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00502 
00503   //
00504   std::string::size_type slash_pos;
00505   slash_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00506   if (slash_pos==std::string::npos) {
00507     slash_pos=0;
00508   }
00509   std::string::size_type ext_pos;
00510   ext_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_EXTSEP);
00511   if ((ext_pos!=std::string::npos)&&(ext_pos>slash_pos)) {
00512     tmp_path.erase(ext_pos);
00513   }
00514   //printf("Fs::noextname1('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00515   return tmp_path;
00516 }
00517 
00518 std::string Fs::noextnameN(const std::string& path, int cnt)
00519 {
00520   // unixify the string.
00521   std::string tmp_path=path;
00522   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00523 
00524   // no change.
00525   if (cnt==0) {
00526     return tmp_path;
00527   }
00528 
00529   //
00530   std::string::size_type fn_start;
00531   fn_start=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00532   if (fn_start==std::string::npos) {
00533     fn_start=0;
00534   }
00535   else {
00536     fn_start+=1; // the first char after the "/"
00537   }
00538   std::string::size_type fn_end=tmp_path.size();
00539 
00540   std::string::size_type tmp_pos=std::string::npos;
00541   for (int n=0;n<cnt;n++) {
00542     //printf("Fs::noextnameN(): str=%d,%d '%s'\n",int(fn_start),int(fn_end),
00543     //       tmp_path.substr(fn_start,fn_end-fn_start).c_str());
00544     tmp_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_EXTSEP,fn_end-1);
00545     if ((tmp_pos==std::string::npos)||(tmp_pos<fn_start)) {
00546       //printf("break; tmp_pos=%d\n",int(tmp_pos));
00547       break;
00548     }
00549     fn_end=tmp_pos;
00550   }
00551   //
00552   tmp_path.erase(fn_end);
00553 
00554   //printf("Fs::noextnameN('%s',%d)=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),cnt,tmp_path.c_str());
00555   return tmp_path;
00556 }
00557 
00558 void Fs::splitPath(const std::string& path,std::string& drive,std::vector<std::string>& parts) {
00559   std::string::size_type s_pos;
00560   std::string::size_type e_pos;
00561   
00562   // clear our outputs before doing work.
00563   drive="";
00564   parts.clear();
00565   clearErr();
00566 
00567   std::string tmp_path=normalizePath(path);
00568   
00569   // split off the drive. ("C:")
00570   if ((tmp_path.size()>=2)&&(tmp_path[1]==':')) {
00571       drive=tmp_path.substr(0,2);
00572       tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(2);
00573   }
00574   else {
00575     drive="";
00576   }
00577 
00578   if (tmp_path=="") {
00579     return;
00580   }
00581 
00582   s_pos=0;
00583   e_pos=0;
00584   while (true) {
00585     e_pos=tmp_path.find(FS_PATHSEP,s_pos);
00586     //printf("  %d-%d = '%s'\n",int(s_pos),int(e_pos),tmp_path.substr(s_pos,e_pos-s_pos).c_str());
00587     if (e_pos==0) {
00588       // an abs path, push "/" as the first value.
00589       parts.push_back(FS_PATHSEP);
00590     }
00591     else if (e_pos==std::string::npos) {
00592       parts.push_back(tmp_path.substr(s_pos));
00593       // and we are done.
00594       break;
00595     }
00596     else {
00597       parts.push_back(tmp_path.substr(s_pos,e_pos-s_pos));
00598     }
00599     //printf("  %d-%d = '%s'\n",int(s_pos),int(e_pos),parts[parts.size()-1].c_str());
00600 
00601     // advance
00602     s_pos=e_pos+1;
00603     if (s_pos>=tmp_path.size()) {
00604       break;
00605     }
00606   }
00607 }
00608 
00609 // @todo should have a switch to choose between "noextname1" and "noextname".
00610 std::vector<std::string> Fs::changeDirAndExt(const std::string& new_dir,
00611                                                  const std::vector<std::string>& paths,
00612                                                  const std::string& new_ext)
00613 {
00614   std::vector<std::string> out;
00615   out.reserve(paths.size());
00616 
00617   for(unsigned int i=0;i<paths.size();i++) {
00618     out.push_back(join(new_dir,noextname1(basename(paths[i]))+new_ext));
00619   }
00620   return out;
00621 }

00625 
00626 std::string Fs::convertToUncPath(const std::string& str) {
00627   return Fs::convertToUncPath(str,FS_UNC_SHORTLEN);
00628 }
00629 
00630 std::string Fs::convertToUncPath(const std::string& str,int uncshortlen) {
00631   std::string tmp=str;
00632 #ifdef _WIN32
00633   convertToUncPathInPlace(tmp,uncshortlen);
00634 #else
00635   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00636 #endif
00637   return tmp;
00638 }
00639 
00640 AptErr_t Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(std::string& path) {
00641   return Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(path,FS_UNC_SHORTLEN);
00642 }
00643 
00644 AptErr_t Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(std::string& path,int uncshortlen) {
00645 #ifndef _WIN32
00646   return Fs::normalizePathInPlace(path);
00647 #else
00648   // if the path is less than 260 it can be used as is.
00649   // (lets round down to 220)
00650   // actually lets not do it to make testing better.
00651   // if (out.size()<240) {
00652   //  return out;
00653   // }
00654 
00655   // nothing to do?
00656   if (path=="") {
00657     return clearErr();
00658   }
00659 
00660   // flip the slashes to back slashes...
00661   // do this in case some one joined an already converted path with "/"s.
00662   std::replace(path.begin(),path.end(),'/','\\');
00663 
00664   // now check if it has already been done.
00665   if ( path.substr(0,4) == std::string("\\\\?\\") ) {
00666     return APT_OK;
00667   }
00668 
00669   if (path.substr(0,2) == std::string("\\\\") ) {
00670     path = std::string("\\\\?\\UNC") + path.substr(1);
00671     return APT_OK;
00672   }
00673 
00674   // dont bother converting short paths.
00675   if ((uncshortlen==0)||(((int)path.size())<uncshortlen)) {
00676     return APT_OK;
00677   }
00678 
00679 
00680   std::wstring wsrcpath = Util::toWString(path);
00681   wchar_t wdstpath_char[UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ];
00682   
00683   // Compute the absolute path. We use the wide char
00684   // version which can handle > MAX_PATH
00685   DWORD rv=GetFullPathNameW(wsrcpath.c_str(),UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ, wdstpath_char, NULL);
00686 
00687   if (rv==0) {
00688     APT_ERR_ABORT("GetFullPathNameW failed.");
00689   }
00690 
00691   path = Util::toString( wdstpath_char );
00692 
00693   // if there is something there, tack on the "\\?\" prefix.
00694   // so we and windows know this is a UNC path.
00695   if (path!="") {
00696     path="\\\\?\\"+path;
00697   }
00698   //
00699   return APT_OK;
00700 #endif
00701 }
00702 
00703 //////////
00704 
00705 std::string Fs::convertCommandToUnc(const std::string& cmd) {
00706   // find the first sep
00707   std::string::size_type pos;
00708   pos=cmd.find(" ");
00709 
00710   // no sep? then no change.
00711   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00712     return cmd;
00713   }
00714 
00715   // split the command into exe and args.
00716   std::string cmd_exe=cmd.substr(0,pos);
00717   std::string cmd_args=cmd.substr(pos);
00718 
00719   // change the command
00720   std::string cmd_exe_unc=Fs::convertToUncPath(cmd_exe);
00721   
00722   // put it back together.
00723   return cmd_exe_unc+cmd_args;
00724 }
00725 
00726 //////////
00727 
00728 bool Fs::exists(const std::string& path) {
00729   int stat_rv;
00730   struct stat stat_buf;
00731 
00732   stat_rv = Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00733   if (stat_rv==0) {
00734     clearErr();
00735     return true;
00736   }
00737   //
00738   setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00739   return false;
00740 }
00741 
00742 bool Fs::dirExists(const std::string& path) {
00743   int stat_rv;
00744   struct stat stat_buf;
00745 
00746   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00747   if (stat_rv!=0) {
00748     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00749     return false;
00750   }
00751   
00752   if (!(S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode))) {
00753     setErr(APT_ERR,"dirExists(): not a dir",false);
00754     return false;
00755   }
00756   
00757   clearErr();
00758   return true;
00759 }
00760 
00761 bool Fs::fileExists(const std::string& path) {
00762   int stat_rv;
00763   struct stat stat_buf;
00764 
00765   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00766   if (stat_rv!=0) {
00767     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00768     return false;
00769   }
00770   
00771   if (!S_ISREG(stat_buf.st_mode)) {
00772     setErr(APT_ERR,"fileExists(): not a file",false);
00773     return false;
00774   }
00775   
00776   clearErr();
00777   return true;
00778 }
00779 
00780 bool Fs::isReadable(const std::string& path) {
00781   AptErr_t rv;
00782   return isReadable(path,rv);
00783 }
00784 
00785 bool Fs::isReadable(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv)
00786 {
00787   int stat_rv;
00788   struct stat stat_buf;
00789 
00790   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00791   if (stat_rv!=APT_OK) {
00792     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00793     return false;
00794   }
00795   return Fs__isreadable(stat_buf);
00796 }
00797 
00798 bool Fs::isWriteable(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv)
00799 {
00800   int stat_rv;
00801   struct stat stat_buf;
00802 
00803   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00804   if (stat_rv!=APT_OK) {
00805     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00806     return false;
00807   }
00808   return Fs__iswriteable(stat_buf);
00809 }
00810 
00811 bool Fs::isWriteable(const std::string& path) {
00812   AptErr_t rv;
00813   return isWriteable(path,rv);
00814 }
00815 
00816 bool Fs::isReadableDir(const std::string& path) {
00817   AptErr_t rv;
00818   return isReadableDir(path,rv);
00819 }
00820 
00821 bool Fs::isReadableDir(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv)
00822 {
00823   int stat_rv;
00824   struct stat stat_buf;
00825 
00826   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00827   if (stat_rv!=APT_OK) {
00828     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00829     return false;
00830   }
00831   if (!(S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode))||(Fs__isreadable(stat_buf)==false)) {
00832     return false;
00833   }
00834   return true;
00835 }
00836 
00837 bool Fs::isWriteableDir(const std::string& path) {
00838   AptErr_t rv;
00839   return isWriteableDir(path,rv);
00840 }
00841 
00842 bool Fs::isWriteableDir(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv) {
00843   int stat_rv;
00844   struct stat stat_buf;
00845 
00846   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00847   // no path.
00848   if (stat_rv!=0) {
00849     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00850     return false;
00851   }
00852 
00853   // we would like to just write this:
00854   // return S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode)&&Fs__iswriteable(stat_buf);
00855   // but we cant on windows.  Why?
00856   // Sometimes windows has it marked read only, but that is just
00857   // shorthand for "special".
00858   // See http://jira.ev.affymetrix.com:8080/browse/APT-380
00859 
00860   // this isnt a dir, so we fail.
00861   if (S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode)==0) {
00862     return false;
00863   }
00864   // os says it is writeable, so we succeed
00865   if (Fs__iswriteable(stat_buf)==true) {
00866     return true;
00867   }
00868 
00869   // so now it is a dir, but os says it is read-only...
00870 
00871 #ifdef _WIN32
00872   // however... on windows we check to see if we can write to it anyways.
00873   /// @todo generate a better test name.
00874   std::string probe_path=Fs::join(path,"Fs-Test-2009323948.tmp");
00875 
00876   if (fileExists(probe_path)) {
00877     APT_ERR_ABORT("Probefile "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(probe_path)+" exists already. It shouldnt.");
00878   }
00879   // try and create the file.
00880   Fs::touch(probe_path,false);
00881   // did it work?
00882   if (fileExists(probe_path)) {
00883     // yep get rid of it
00884     Fs::rm(probe_path);
00885     // and say we did.
00886     return true;
00887   }
00888 #endif
00889 
00890   // unix doesnt lie... we cant write, say we cant.
00891   return false;
00892 }
00893 
00894 //////////
00895 
00896 /// @brief     Does the file exist and start with the sequence of bytes.
00897 /// @param     path      path to the file to test.
00898 /// @param     bytes     vector of ints with a terminal "0".
00899 /// @return    true if the file does exist and have the byte sequence.
00900 static bool file_starts_with(const std::string& path,const int* magic_bytes) {
00901   std::fstream fs;
00902 
00903   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path, std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
00904   if (!fs.good()) {
00905     return false;
00906   }
00907 
00908   for (int i=0;magic_bytes[i]!=0;i++) {
00909     if (fs.get()!=magic_bytes[i]) {
00910       fs.close();
00911       return false;
00912     }
00913   }
00914   fs.close();
00915   return true;
00916 }
00917 
00918 bool Fs::isHdf5File(const std::string& path) {
00919   int magic_bytes[]={ 0x89, 0x48, 0x44, 0x46, 0x0d, 0x00 }; // H D F
00920   return file_starts_with(path,magic_bytes);
00921 }
00922 
00923 bool Fs::isCalvinFile(const std::string& path) {
00924   int magic_bytes[]={ 0x3b, 0x01, 0x00 }; // the short calvin magic.
00925   return file_starts_with(path,magic_bytes);
00926 }
00927 
00928 bool Fs::isBinaryFile(const std::string& path)
00929 {
00930   std::fstream fs;
00931   
00932   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path, std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
00933   if (!fs.good()) {
00934     return false;
00935   }
00936 
00937   int cnt_txt=0;
00938   int cnt_bin=0;
00939   for (int i=0;i<1024;i++) {
00940     int c=fs.get();
00941     // the end?
00942     if (c==-1) {
00943       break;
00944     }
00945     // text?
00946     if (((c>=0x20)&&(c<=0x7E)) // " " -- "~"
00947         || (c==0x09) // "\t"
00948         || (c==0x0A) // "\n"
00949         || (c==0x0D) // "\r"
00950         ) {
00951       cnt_txt++;
00952       continue;
00953     }
00954     cnt_bin++;
00955   }
00956 
00957   // maybe compute some ratio?
00958   double cnt_total=cnt_bin+cnt_txt;
00959   if (cnt_total==0) {
00960     return false;
00961   }
00962   // for now, if there are any, we take the file as being binary.
00963   if (cnt_bin>0) {
00964     return true;
00965   }
00966   // not binary. (Which is not the same as text.)
00967   return false;
00968 }
00969 
00970 //////////
00971 
00972 int64_t Fs::fileSize(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
00973   AptErr_t errnum;
00974   int64_t file_size=fileSize(path,errnum);
00975   //
00976   if ((errnum!=APT_OK)&&(abortOnErr==true)) {
00977     setErr(getErrNum(),getErrMsg(),abortOnErr);
00978   }
00979   return file_size;
00980 }
00981 
00982 int64_t Fs::fileSize(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& errnum) {
00983   int stat_rv;
00984   struct stat stat_buf;
00985 
00986   int64_t file_size=-1;
00987   if ((errnum=Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false))==APT_OK) {
00988     file_size=stat_buf.st_size;
00989   }
00990   return file_size;
00991 }
00992 
00993 //////////
00994 
00995 AptErr_t Fs::chmodBasic(const std::string& path,int mode,bool abortOnErr)
00996 {
00997   int rv;
00998 #ifdef _WIN32
00999   // http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb463216.aspx
01000   // This only works at the user level.
01001   // http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1z319a54.aspx
01002   // When both constants are given, they are joined with the bitwise OR operator ( |  ).
01003   // If write permission is not given, the file is read-only. Note that all files are always readable;
01004   // it is not possible to give write-only permission. Thus, the modes _S_IWRITE and _S_IREAD | _S_IWRITE are equivalent.
01005   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01006   rv=POSIX_CHMOD(unc_path.c_str(),mode);
01007 #else
01008   rv=POSIX_CHMOD(path.c_str(),mode);
01009 #endif
01010   if (rv!=0) {
01011     return setErr(APT_ERR,"chmod failed. "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01012   }
01013 
01014   return clearErr();
01015 }
01016 
01017 //////////
01018 
01019 AptErr_t Fs::listDir(const std::string& path,std::vector<std::string>& names,bool abortOnErr)
01020 {
01021   clearErr();
01022 
01023   names.resize(0);
01024 
01025   if (path=="") {
01026     setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,"blank path.",abortOnErr);
01027   }
01028 
01029 #ifdef _WIN32
01030   // We need the "*" to match files.
01031   // This isnt just opening the dir and reading the contents,
01032   // but rather "what matches?".
01033   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(join(path,"*"));
01034   //
01035   WIN32_FIND_DATAW ffd;
01036   HANDLE hFind = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
01037   DWORD rv=0;
01038 
01039   hFind = FindFirstFileW(unc_path.c_str(), &ffd);
01040   if (INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE == hFind) {
01041     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,Util::toString(unc_path),abortOnErr);
01042   }
01043 
01044   while (true) {
01045     std::string tmp_name = Util::toString(ffd.cFileName);
01046     if (!((tmp_name==".")||(tmp_name==".."))) {
01047       names.push_back(tmp_name);
01048     }
01049     if (FindNextFileW(hFind, &ffd)==0) {
01050       break;
01051     }
01052   }
01053   FindClose(hFind);
01054 #else
01055   DIR *d_p;
01056   struct dirent* de_p;
01057 
01058   d_p=opendir(path.c_str());
01059   if (d_p==NULL) {
01060     return setErr(APT_ERR,"osListDir failed. "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01061   }
01062   //int cnt=0;
01063   std::string tmp_name;
01064   while ((de_p=readdir(d_p))!=NULL) {
01065     //printf(" %2d: '%s'\n",cnt++,de_p->d_name);
01066     //
01067     tmp_name=de_p->d_name;
01068     if ((tmp_name==".")||(tmp_name=="..")) {
01069       continue;
01070     }
01071     // add it
01072     names.push_back(tmp_name);
01073   }
01074   closedir(d_p);
01075 #endif
01076 
01077   // return them in order.
01078   sort(names.begin(),names.end());
01079   return clearErr();
01080 }
01081 
01082 //////////
01083 
01084 AptErr_t Fs::mkdir(const std::string& path,
01085                    //bool errIfExists,
01086                    bool abortOnErr) {
01087   int rv;
01088 
01089 #ifdef _WIN32
01090   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01091   rv=POSIX_MKDIR(unc_path.c_str());
01092 #else
01093   rv=POSIX_MKDIR(path.c_str(), 0777);
01094 #endif
01095   //
01096    if (rv!=0) {
01097      return setErrFromErrno(path,abortOnErr);
01098    }
01099    return clearErr();
01100 }
01101 
01102 AptErr_t Fs::mkdirPath(const std::string& path,
01103                        bool abortOnErr) {
01104   clearErr();
01105 
01106   std::string drive;
01107   std::vector<std::string> parts;
01108   splitPath(path,drive,parts);
01109 
01110   if (parts.size()==0) {
01111       return APT_OK;
01112   }
01113 
01114   AptErr_t tmp_err;
01115   std::string tmp_path;
01116   std::string tmp_drive_path;
01117   for (size_t i=0;i<parts.size();i++) {
01118     tmp_path=join(tmp_path,parts[i]);
01119     tmp_drive_path=drive+tmp_path;
01120     if (!dirExists(tmp_drive_path)) {
01121       tmp_err=mkdir(tmp_drive_path,false);
01122       if (!dirExists(tmp_drive_path)) {
01123         return setErr(APT_ERR,"mkdirPath failed."+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_drive_path),abortOnErr);
01124       }
01125     }
01126   }
01127 
01128   return clearErr();
01129 }
01130 
01131 AptErr_t Fs::ensureWriteableDirPath(const std::string& path,
01132                                     bool abortOnErr) {
01133   if (!isWriteableDir(path)) {
01134     mkdirPath(path,false);
01135     if (isWriteableDir(path)) {
01136       return clearErr();
01137     }
01138     return setErr(APT_ERR,path,abortOnErr);
01139   }
01140   return clearErr();
01141 }
01142 
01143 //////////
01144 
01145 /// @todo take an atime to adjust the file access to.
01146 AptErr_t Fs::touch(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr)
01147 {
01148   std::fstream fs;
01149 
01150   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path,  std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
01151 
01152   // try and open for reading.
01153   if (fs.is_open()) {
01154     // worked so we are done.
01155     fs.close();
01156     return clearErr();
01157   }
01158 
01159   // open for read didnt work, try to write to it.
01160   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path, std::ios::out|std::ios::binary);
01161 
01162   if (fs.is_open()) {
01163     // worked (Which created the file.)
01164     fs.close();
01165     return clearErr();
01166   }
01167 
01168   return setErr(APT_ERR,"touch of "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" failed.",abortOnErr);
01169 }
01170 
01171 //////////
01172 
01173 
01174 #ifdef _WIN32
01175 int64_t Fs::getFreeDiskSpace(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
01176   ULARGE_INTEGER lpFreeBytesAvailable;
01177   ULARGE_INTEGER lpTotalNumberOfBytes;
01178   ULARGE_INTEGER lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes;
01179 
01180   clearErr();
01181 
01182   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01183 
01184   if (!GetDiskFreeSpaceExW(unc_path.c_str(),
01185                           &lpFreeBytesAvailable,
01186                           &lpTotalNumberOfBytes,
01187                           &lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes)) {
01188     setErr(APT_ERR,"getFreeDiskSpaceNative of "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" failed.",abortOnErr);
01189     return -1;
01190   }
01191   
01192   return lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes.QuadPart;
01193 }
01194 #endif
01195 
01196 #if defined(__linux__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01197 int64_t Fs::getFreeDiskSpace(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
01198   struct statfs retBuf;
01199   clearErr();
01200 
01201   if (statfs(path.c_str(), &retBuf)!=0) {
01202     setErr(APT_ERR,"getFreeDiskSpaceNative of "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" failed. "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01203     return -1;
01204   }
01205   return int64_t(retBuf.f_bavail) * int64_t(retBuf.f_bsize);
01206 }
01207 #endif
01208 
01209 //////////
01210 
01211 AptErr_t Fs::rm(const std::string& path,
01212                 //bool errIfNotExists,
01213                 bool abortOnErr) {
01214   int rv;
01215 #ifdef _WIN32
01216   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01217   rv=POSIX_UNLINK(unc_path.c_str());
01218 #else
01219   rv=POSIX_UNLINK(path.c_str());
01220 #endif
01221   if (rv!=0) {
01222     return setErrFromErrno(path,abortOnErr);
01223   }
01224   return clearErr();
01225 }
01226 
01227 AptErr_t Fs::rmIfExists(const std::string& path,
01228                 bool abortOnErr) {
01229   if (fileExists(path)) {
01230     return rm(path,abortOnErr);
01231   }
01232   return clearErr();
01233 }
01234 
01235 //////////
01236 
01237 AptErr_t Fs::rmdir(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr)
01238 {
01239   clearErr();
01240 
01241   if (path=="/") {
01242     return setErr(APT_ERR,"Wont remove root dir.",abortOnErr);
01243   }
01244   if (!dirExists(path)) {
01245     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,"does not exist.",abortOnErr);
01246   }
01247 
01248 #ifdef _WIN32
01249   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01250   bool rv=RemoveDirectoryW(unc_path.c_str())==TRUE;
01251   if (rv==true) {
01252     return setErr(APT_OK,"",abortOnErr);
01253   }
01254 #else
01255   // posix
01256   int rv=::rmdir(path.c_str());
01257   if (rv==0) {
01258     return clearErr();
01259   }
01260   /// @todo handle errs
01261   return setErr(APT_ERR,"rmdir "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01262 #endif
01263   return clearErr();
01264 }
01265 
01266 AptErr_t Fs::rmdirPath(const std::string& path,
01267                        bool abortOnErr) {
01268   if (path=="") {
01269     return clearErr();
01270   }
01271   
01272   std::string drive;
01273   std::vector<std::string> tmp_parts;
01274   splitPath(path,drive,tmp_parts);
01275   
01276   std::string tmp_path;
01277   std::string tmp_drive_path;
01278   while (tmp_parts.size()>0) {
01279     tmp_path=Fs::join(tmp_parts);
01280     tmp_drive_path=drive+tmp_path;
01281     Fs::rmdir(tmp_drive_path,abortOnErr);
01282     if (Fs::dirExists(tmp_drive_path)) {
01283       return setErr(APT_ERR,tmp_drive_path,abortOnErr);
01284     }
01285     tmp_parts.pop_back();
01286   }
01287   
01288   return clearErr();
01289 }
01290 
01291 //////////
01292 
01293 AptErr_t Fs::rm_rf(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr)
01294 {
01295   // try and protect against trival mistakes.
01296   if ((path=="/")||(path==".")||(path=="")) {
01297     return setErr(APT_ERR,"wont attempt to remove "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
01298   }
01299   
01300   if (fileExists(path)) {
01301     return rm(path);
01302   }
01303   if (dirExists(path)) {
01304     std::vector<std::string> names;
01305     listDir(path,names);
01306     for (unsigned int i=0;i<names.size();i++) {
01307       rm_rf(Fs::join(path,names[i]));
01308     }
01309     rmdir(path);
01310     if (dirExists(path)) {
01311       return setErr(APT_ERR,"dir still there.",abortOnErr);
01312     }
01313     return clearErr();
01314   }
01315   //
01316   return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,"rm_rf(): "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" does not exist.",abortOnErr);
01317 }
01318 
01319 //////////
01320 
01321 #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__linux__)
01322 bool Fs::isSameVolume(const std::string& path1,
01323                       const std::string& path2,
01324                       AptErr_t& rv,
01325                       bool abortOnErr)
01326 {
01327   int stat_rv;
01328   struct stat stat_buf1;
01329   struct stat stat_buf2;
01330 
01331   clearErr();
01332 
01333   Fs__stat(path1,stat_buf1,stat_rv,abortOnErr);
01334   Fs__stat(path2,stat_buf2,stat_rv,abortOnErr);
01335 
01336   if (stat_buf1.st_dev==stat_buf2.st_dev) {
01337     return true;
01338   }
01339   return false;
01340 }
01341 #endif
01342 
01343 #ifdef _WIN32
01344 bool Fs::isSameVolume(const std::string& path1,
01345                       const std::string& path2,
01346                       AptErr_t& rv,
01347                       bool abortOnErr)
01348 {
01349 
01350   rv = APT_OK;
01351   wchar_t volumeNameBuffer1[UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ];
01352   wchar_t volumeNameBuffer2[UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ];
01353   
01354   clearErr();
01355 
01356   std::wstring tmp_path1=Fs::UncW(path1);
01357   std::wstring tmp_path2=Fs::UncW(path2);
01358 
01359   if (!GetVolumePathNameW(tmp_path1.c_str(),
01360                          volumeNameBuffer1,
01361                          UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ)) {
01362     rv = APT_ERR;
01363     setErr(APT_ERR,"Fs::isSameVolume() - GetVolumePathName() failed.",abortOnErr);
01364     return false;
01365   }
01366 
01367   if (!GetVolumePathNameW(tmp_path2.c_str(),
01368                          volumeNameBuffer2,
01369                          UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ)) {
01370     rv = APT_ERR;
01371     setErr(APT_ERR,"Fs::isSameVolume() - GetVolumePathName() failed.",abortOnErr);
01372     return false;
01373   }
01374 
01375   //
01376   if ( wcscmp(volumeNameBuffer1,volumeNameBuffer2) == 0 ) {
01377     // now we know they are on the same volume...
01378     return true;
01379   }
01380   // not the same volume.
01381   return false;
01382 
01383 }
01384 #endif
01385 
01386 #ifdef _WIN32
01387 std::string Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString( const std::string & whence )
01388 {
01389   // Retrieve the system error message for the last-error code
01390 
01391   
01392   LPVOID lpMsgBuf;
01393   DWORD dw = GetLastError();
01394 
01395   FormatMessage(
01396                 FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER |
01397                 FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM |
01398                 FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS,
01399                 NULL,
01400                 dw,
01401                 MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_DEFAULT),
01402                 (LPTSTR) &lpMsgBuf,
01403                 0, NULL );
01404 
01405   std::stringstream msgSStr;
01406 
01407   if ( ! whence.empty() ) {
01408     msgSStr << whence << " failed with error " << dw << ": " << (LPTSTR) lpMsgBuf ;
01409   }
01410   else {
01411     msgSStr << (LPTSTR) lpMsgBuf;
01412   }
01413   LocalFree(lpMsgBuf);
01414 
01415   return msgSStr.str();
01416 }
01417 
01418 #endif

01471 
01472 std::string Fs::findLibFile(const std::string &fileName, const std::string &searchPath){
01473 
01474     if(fileName == "") {
01475         // empty string is not valid file name. just return it back
01476         return fileName;
01477     } else if(Fs::fileExists(fileName)) {
01478         // file exists as already specified
01479         return fileName;
01480     } else {
01481         // Now lets search for the file
01482         std::vector<std::string> searchPathVec;
01483         if(searchPath != "") {
01484             // For path separator use ';' on windows.
01485             // Use ':' or ';' on unix.
01486 #ifdef _WIN32
01487           Util::chopString(searchPath,';',searchPathVec);
01488 #else
01489           Util::chopString(searchPath,":;",searchPathVec);
01490 #endif
01491         } else {
01492             char *sp = getenv("AFFX_ANALYSIS_FILES_PATH");
01493             if(sp == NULL) {
01494                 return fileName;
01495             } else {
01496               Util::chopString(sp,':',searchPathVec);
01497             }
01498         }
01499 
01500         for(int i=0; i< searchPathVec.size(); i++) {
01501           if(Fs::fileExists(Fs::join(searchPathVec[i] , fileName)))
01502              return Fs::join(searchPathVec[i] , fileName);
01503         }
01504     }
01505 
01506     // did not find anything, so just return what we started with
01507     return fileName;
01508 }
01509 
01510 /**
01511  * Open an ofstream for writing to. Abort if can't open
01512  * for some reason.
01513  * @param out - stream to be opened.
01514  * @param fileName - name of file to be opened.
01515  */
01516 void Fs::mustOpenToWrite(std::ofstream &out, const std::string &fileName) {
01517   assert(!fileName.empty());
01518   Fs::aptOpen(out, fileName);
01519   if(!out.is_open() || !out.good()) {
01520     APT_ERR_ABORT("Couldn't open file: " +FS_QUOTE_PATH(fileName) + " to write.");
01521   }
01522 
01523   // Set to throw an exception if something bad happens rather than silently fail.
01524   out.exceptions(std::ofstream::eofbit | std::ofstream::failbit | std::ofstream::badbit );
01525 }
01526 
01527 /**
01528  * Close an output stream making sure that it is ok before doing so.
01529  * @param out - stream to be closed.
01530  */
01531 void Fs::carefulClose(std::ofstream &out) {
01532   // If file is open, do some checks to make sure that it was successful...
01533   if(out.is_open()) {
01534     if(out.bad()) {
01535       APT_ERR_ABORT("Fs::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
01536     }
01537   }
01538   out.close();
01539 }
01540 
01541 /**
01542  * Close an output stream making sure that it is ok before doing so.
01543  * @param out - stream to be closed.
01544  */
01545 void Fs::carefulClose(std::fstream &out) {
01546   // If file is open, do some checks to make sure that it was successful...
01547   if(out.is_open()) {
01548     if(out.bad()) {
01549       APT_ERR_ABORT("Fs::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
01550     }
01551   }
01552   out.close();
01553 }

01555 
01556 /**
01557  * Return true on success. False otherwise
01558  * @param in - file to copy
01559  * @param out - name of the new file
01560  */
01561 bool Fs::fileCopy(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, bool throwOnError) {
01562   ///@todo there is probably a better way to copy files and check for errors
01563   bool success = true;
01564 
01565   std::ifstream is;
01566   std::ofstream os;
01567   std::string iName = in;
01568   std::string oName = out;
01569 
01570   Fs::aptOpen(is, in, std::ios::binary);
01571 
01572   Fs::aptOpen(os, out, std::ios::binary);
01573 
01574   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
01575       success = false;
01576 
01577   os << is.rdbuf();
01578   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
01579       success = false;
01580 
01581   is.close();
01582   os.close();
01583   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
01584       success = false;
01585 
01586   if(throwOnError && !success)
01587       APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to copy file '" + iName + "' to '" + oName + "'");
01588   return success;
01589 }
01590 
01591 /**
01592  * Not intended to direct use. Only indirectly via Fs::fileRename()
01593  * We make multiple attempts to get around read lock issues.
01594  */
01595 static bool _uncheckedFileRename(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, int tries, int sec) {
01596     tries--;
01597     sec *= 3;
01598     bool success = true;
01599 #ifdef _WIN32
01600     success = (MoveFileExW(Fs::convertToUncPathW(in).c_str(), Fs::convertToUncPathW(out).c_str(),
01601                           MOVEFILE_REPLACE_EXISTING|MOVEFILE_WRITE_THROUGH) != 0);
01602 #else
01603     success = (rename(in.c_str(), out.c_str()) == 0);
01604 #endif
01605     if(!success && (tries > 0)) {
01606 #ifdef _WIN32
01607       Sleep(sec);
01608 #else      
01609       sleep(sec);
01610 #endif        
01611       return _uncheckedFileRename(in, out, tries, sec);
01612     }
01613     
01614     return success;
01615 }
01616 /**
01617  * Return true on success. False otherwise
01618  * @param in - file to move
01619  * @param out - name of the new file
01620  */
01621 bool Fs::fileRename(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, bool throwOnError) {
01622     bool success = true;
01623     success = _uncheckedFileRename(in,out,4,10);
01624   if(throwOnError && !success)
01625       APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to rename file '" + in + "' to '" + out + "'");
01626   return success;
01627 }
